titles.title: To amend the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to modify temporarily certain rates of duty.
Miscellaneous Tariff Bill Act of 2018

Miscellaneous Tariff Bill Act of 2018

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Mr. Bishop (MI) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4318.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 402 - 0 (Roll no. 18).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Senate Committee on Finance discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Brady (TX) moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the Senate amendments to H.R. 4318.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to by voice vote.

reference.label: text as House agreed to Senate amendment

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
Miscellaneous Tariff Bill Act of 2018
This bill amends the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to: (1) repeal expired reductions in rates of duty for specified chemicals and other items; and (2) provide for duty suspensions and reductions through December 31, 2020, for specified chemicals and other items.
(Sec. 1665) The bill amends the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 to extend through October 13, 2027 (currently, July 21, 2027), the authority of the Department of the Treasury to collect certain customs user fees for the processing of formally or informally entered or released merchandise.
